value.title: Facial Recognition Start-Up Mounts a First Amendment Defense in Privacy Suits
value.excerpt: Clearview AI has hired Floyd Abrams, a top lawyer, to help fight claims that selling its data to law enforcement agencies violates privacy laws.

value.title: Researchers find ‘inconsistent’ benchmarking across 3,867 AI research papers
value.excerpt: A survey of over 3,000 machine learning and AI research papers found little in the way of consistency with respect to benchmark metrics.

value.title: Artificial Intelligence And Data Privacy – Turning A Risk Into A Benefit
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence applications are not open, and can put privacy at risk. The addition of good tools to address privacy for data being used by AI systems is an important early step in adding trust into the AI equation.

value.title: AI Needs To Learn Multi-Intent For Computers To Show Empathy
value.excerpt: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is smart, but it could do better. The software development industry is constantly working to push algorithmic logic beyond the scope of the current computer processing envelope and create new ways for computers to ‘think’ and emulate human beings.

value.title: How The Federal Government’s AI Center Of Excellence Is Impacting Government-Wide Adoption Of AI
value.excerpt: The GSA's AI Center of Excellence aims to improve and enhance AI implementations in the government and help agencies on their journey with AI adoption. The relatively small team at the GSA AI CoE is helping to bring about some very impressive changes within the federal government.

value.title: Why ‘human-like’ is a low bar for most AI projects
value.excerpt: Show me a human-like machine and I’ll show you a faulty piece of tech. The AI market is expected to eclipse $300 billion by 2025. And the vast majority of the companies trying to cash in on that bonanza are marketing some form of “human-like” AI.

value.title: Google adds Digital Ink Recognition API for touch and stylus input to ML Kit
value.excerpt: Google introduced a new API for touch and stylus input to ML Kit, its machine learning development toolkit for Android and iOS.

value.title: Google's new voice and audio settings give you more control over your privacy
value.excerpt: Google on Wednesday let people know it's still having humans review voice and audio recordings on devices like Google Home. However, the search giant's email also said it's giving you more control over what's being shared and has automatically turned off the feature for all accounts.

value.title: The survivor: last Korean war criminal in Japan wants recognition
value.excerpt: To the casual observer, 95-year-old Lee Hak-rae could be just another elderly person in Japan. Surrounded by pictures of his family and paintings by his great-grandchildren, Lee potters about his cluttered living room on the outskirts of Tokyo.

value.title: Microsoft, Amazon back a SoCal company making microchips specifically for voice-based apps
value.excerpt: Microsoft’s venture capital fund, M12 Ventures, has led a slew of strategic corporate investors backing a new chip developer out of Southern California called Syntiant, which makes semiconductors for voice recognition and speech-based applications.
